requirement_tested: User authentication and account management system with role-based access control.
user_persona: A new volunteer named Sarah who wants to sign up and access her dashboard.
user_goal: To register as a volunteer, log in, and access her personalized dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Site and Registering
narrative_steps.description: Sarah visits the homepage for the first time and decides to register as a volunteer. She clicks the 'Register' link in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Register' link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A registration modal form appears with fields for name, email, password, and role selection.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Registration Form
narrative_steps.description: Sarah fills out her details, selects 'volunteer' as her role, and submits the form.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in name, email, password, select 'volunteer' role, and click 'Submit'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The form data is sent to the authAPI, a new user is created in the database, and she is redirected to the login page with a success message.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Sarah enters her newly created credentials into the login form.
narrative_steps.action: Enter email and password into the login form and click 'Login'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Credentials are validated via authAPI, a session token is set, and she is redirected to her volunteer dashboard.

requirement_tested: Allow users to browse and search food donation listings with filtering capabilities.
user_persona: A recipient named Marcus looking for nearby available food donations.
user_goal: To find and view details of available food donations near his location.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Donations
narrative_steps.description: Marcus logs in and navigates to the Donations page to see all available donations.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Donations' link in the navbar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: He sees a grid of donation cards with titles, descriptions, quantities, locations, and statuses, styled with Azure background and Midnight Blue components.

narrative_steps.title: Searching by Keyword
narrative_steps.description: Marcus types 'bread' into the search bar to filter donations.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'bread' into the search bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The displayed donations update in real-time to show only those matching the keyword.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Location Filter
narrative_steps.description: Marcus uses the location filter to narrow down donations to his city.
narrative_steps.action: Select his city from the location dropdown filter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The donation list updates to show only those available in his selected city.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Donation Details
narrative_steps.description: Marcus clicks on a promising donation card to see more information.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a donation card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: He is taken to the detailed view page for that specific donation.

requirement_tested: Enable recipients to apply for food distribution and allow administrators/volunteers to manage these applications.
user_persona: A recipient named Lisa who needs food assistance and wants to apply for distribution.
user_goal: To submit an application for receiving food distribution.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Application Process
narrative_steps.description: Lisa, logged in as a recipient, finds a suitable donation and chooses to apply for it.
narrative_steps.action: From the donation detail page, click the 'Apply for Distribution' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A multi-step application form opens, pre-filled with some of her profile information.

narrative_steps.title: Completing Application Form
narrative_steps.description: Lisa fills in the remaining required fields like reason for request and preferred pickup time.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in reason and preferred pickup time, then click 'Submit'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The completed form data is sent to the distributionAPI, which saves the application with status 'applied'.

narrative_steps.title: Confirmation
narrative_steps.description: Lisa expects confirmation that her application was received.
narrative_steps.action: Observe page after submission.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She receives a success message confirming her application has been submitted and can be tracked in her dashboard.

requirement_tested: Display volunteer information and enable volunteers to sign up for opportunities.
user_persona: An existing volunteer named Kevin wanting to help with a new donation opportunity.
user_goal: To view open volunteer opportunities and sign up for one.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Volunteer Opportunities
narrative_steps.description: Kevin, logged in as a volunteer, navigates to the Volunteers section.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Volunteers' link in the navbar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: He sees two sections: one showing active volunteer opportunities and another showing his assigned tasks.

narrative_steps.title: Signing Up for Opportunity
narrative_steps.description: Kevin identifies an appealing opportunity and signs up for it.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Sign Up' button on a volunteer opportunity card.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: His request is processed via the volunteerAPI, he is assigned to the opportunity, and the current volunteer count increments.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Assignment
narrative_steps.description: Kevin checks his assigned tasks to confirm the signup.
narrative_steps.action: Look at the 'My Assigned Tasks' section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The newly signed-up opportunity now appears in his assigned tasks list.

requirement_tested: Provide a centralized dashboard for users to manage personal account information and view relevant activity summaries.
user_persona: A donor named Emma who wants to update her contact info and review past donations.
user_goal: To edit her profile and view her donation history from her dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Emma logs in and goes directly to her dashboard.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Dashboard' link in the navbar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She lands on her personalized dashboard showing her profile, recent activities, and quick links.

narrative_steps.title: Editing Profile Information
narrative_steps.description: Emma notices her phone number is outdated and decides to update it.
narrative_steps.action: Click 'Edit Profile', change the phone number field, and save changes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Her updated phone number is saved via the profileUpdateAPI and reflected immediately on the dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Activity History
narrative_steps.description: Emma scrolls down to see her recent activity, specifically her past donations.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the 'Recent Activities' section and click on a past donation entry.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: She is redirected to the detailed view page of that specific donation.

requirement_tested: Establish and maintain a structured database schema to support all core application entities and relationships.
user_persona: A developer setting up the application locally for the first time.
user_goal: To verify that the database schema is correctly defined and aligns with application requirements.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Migration Files
narrative_steps.description: The developer inspects the migration files to ensure they define the correct tables and relationships.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to `/backend/db/migrations` and open schema definition files.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Files contain properly written SQL `CREATE TABLE` statements for users, donations, distributions, volunteers, and volunteer_opportunities with correct foreign keys.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Table Relationships
narrative_steps.description: The developer verifies that relationships between entities are correctly represented.
narrative_steps.action: Check foreign key constraints linking donations to users, distributions to users and donations, etc.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Foreign key relationships are accurately defined and enforced in the schema.

requirement_tested: Expose all core functionalities through standardized RESTful API endpoints consumable by frontend services.
user_persona: A frontend developer integrating the donation listing feature.
user_goal: To successfully call and consume the donation listing API endpoint.

narrative_steps.title: Locating API Documentation
narrative_steps.description: The developer refers to the API documentation to understand how to fetch donations.
narrative_steps.action: Open the API documentation file to find the GET /donations endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Documentation provides clear instructions on endpoint path, method, headers, and expected response format.

narrative_steps.title: Making API Call
narrative_steps.description: The developer writes code to make a GET request to the donations endpoint.
narrative_steps.action: Write and execute a fetch() call to the donationAPI endpoint.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns a successful JSON response containing a list of donations matching the schema.

requirement_tested: Ensure consistent styling with Azure background and Midnight Blue components while maintaining responsiveness across screen sizes.
user_persona: A QA tester validating visual consistency and responsiveness across devices.
user_goal: To confirm the site maintains correct styling and layout on different screen sizes.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Desktop Layout
narrative_steps.description: Tester loads the homepage on a desktop browser and checks overall styling.
narrative_steps.action: Load homepage in desktop browser and visually inspect background and component colors.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Main background is Azure (#F0FFFF) and interactive components are styled with Midnight Blue (#191970).

narrative_steps.title: Testing Responsive Resize
narrative_steps.description: Tester resizes the browser window to simulate mobile and tablet views.
narrative_steps.action: Gradually resize the browser window width from desktop to mobile size.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts smoothly without breaking, using CSS media queries to rearrange elements appropriately.

requirement_tested: Configure repository-wide npm scripts for streamlined installation and local development startup.
user_persona: A new team member cloning the repository for the first time.
user_goal: To install dependencies and start both frontend and backend servers with a single command.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: After cloning, the developer runs the install script to get everything ready.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` in the terminal at project root.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed without errors.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: The developer starts both frontend and backend servers simultaneously.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in the terminal.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both development servers start concurrently, with frontend running on one port and backend on another.

requirement_tested: Enforce strict validation rules on all user-submitted data to prevent invalid or malicious entries.
user_persona: A user attempting to register with an invalid email address.
user_goal: To observe form validation behavior when entering incorrect data during registration.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Invalid Email
narrative_steps.description: While registering, the user types an obviously wrong email format.
narrative_steps.action: In the email field, type 'invalid-email' and tab away from the field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Inline validation immediately displays an error message indicating invalid email format.

narrative_steps.title: Trying to Submit Invalid Form
narrative_steps.description: Ignoring the error, the user tries to submit the form anyway.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Register' submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Submission is blocked by frontend validation, preventing a network call to the backend.

requirement_tested: Implement fine-grained access controls allowing only authorized users to perform specific actions or view sensitive areas.
user_persona: A regular recipient trying to access the admin panel.
user_goal: To attempt accessing restricted administrative functions without proper authorization.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to Restricted Area
narrative_steps.description: The recipient manually types an admin URL into the browser's address bar.
narrative_steps.action: Manually enter '/admin' into the browser address bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Instead of reaching the admin page, the user is redirected to an unauthorized access page.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Navigation Restrictions
narrative_steps.description: The user looks for admin links in the navigation menu.
narrative_steps.action: Scan the navigation bar for any admin-related links.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: No admin-specific links or panels are visible due to role-based UI flags hiding them.

requirement_tested: Empower users to efficiently locate relevant content using flexible search and advanced filtering mechanisms.
user_persona: A volunteer coordinator trying to find upcoming opportunities requiring specific skills.
user_goal: To filter volunteer opportunities by required skills and start time.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Volunteer Page
narrative_steps.description: The coordinator logs in and goes to the volunteer opportunities page.
narrative_steps.action: Click on 'Volunteers' in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A list of active volunteer opportunities is displayed with search/filter options above.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Skill Filter
narrative_steps.description: The coordinator filters the opportunities by selecting a required skill.
narrative_steps.action: Use the skills filter dropdown to select 'Food Handling' and apply.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only opportunities requiring 'Food Handling' are shown in the list.

narrative_steps.title: Combining With Date Filter
narrative_steps.description: Further narrows the results by specifying a date range.
narrative_steps.action: Set a date range in the time filter and apply again.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results update instantly to reflect opportunities matching both skill and date criteria.
